text: I found today on the street, by chance, two friends who had been fighting. Each one told me the story of why they had fought. Each one told me the truth. Each one of them explained their reasons. The two were right. It was not that one saw one thing and the other saw another, or that one saw one side of things and the other another side. No: each one saw things exactly as they had been, each one saw them with identical criteria. FIN The Book of Desasosiego, 1913-1935
title: Tercero incluido
author: Fernando Pessoa
